definition_en: The name of the Latin script letter A/a.
example: I saw a cat. / 私は猫を見た。

definition_en: Easy to use.
example: He's able to speak three languages fluently. / 彼は、3つの言語を滑舌的に話すことができる。

definition_en: Moving around; astir.
example: The movie is about a boy who loves dogs. / その映画は犬が大好きそうな少年についてです。

definition_en: (usually used predicatively, not attributively, be afraid) Impressed with fear or apprehension; in fear.
example: I'm afraid of spiders. / スピダーに怯える

definition_en: Later; second (of two); next, following, subsequent
example: I'll meet you after the meeting. / ミーティング後、私たちは会う。

definition_en: The whole duration of a being, whether animal, plant, or other kind, being alive.
example: I'm at an age where I can enjoy my hobbies freely. / 私は、趣味を自由に楽しむ年齢です。

definition_en: Gone; gone by; gone away; passed; passed away.
meanings_ja: 時点から（過去の時間を指す）
example: It's been 5 years ago since I graduated. / 私は大学卒業して5年経った

meanings_ja: アレックス (Alex) - a proper noun, likely referring to Alexander the Great or other notable people named Alex
αレックス (Aluseku) - a scientific term for the symbol of the element aluminum
example: The ancient warrior was known as Alexander the Great. / 古代の戦士、アレックス大王と呼ばれました。

definition_en: (with a possessive pronoun) Everything that one is capable of.
example: I'm going to buy all the books on sale. / 私は売り上げる全ての本を買う。

definition_en: The set of letters used when writing in a language.
meanings_ja: 英語で読むための基本文字列
example: The alphabet is the basis for reading and writing in English. / 英語での読み書きの基礎はアルファベットです。

definition_en: Prior to some specified time, either past, present, or future; by this time; previously.
example: I've already finished my homework. / 私は既に宿題を終わらせました。
I love traveling to America. / アメリカに旅行することを愛しています。

definition_en: One
meanings_ja: 一つの (ichi no) - indicating a single unit or instance
定の (jitei no) - used as an indefinite article, similar to "a"
example: I need an answer / 私には一つの答えが必要です

definition_en: In rhythm, the second half of a divided beat.
example: I like reading books and playing games. / 私は読書とゲームが好きです。

definition_en: A response or reply; something said or done in reaction to a statement or question.
example: What's your answer to this question? / これらの質問に対するあなたの答えは何ですか？

definition_en: Someone or something of importance.
example: I'll eat anything. / 私は何でも食べます。

definition_en: A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates.
example: The apple is juicy and sweet. / 林檎はジューシーで甘い。

definition_en: An accepted (but deprecated and rarely used) SI unit of area equal to 100 square metres, or a former unit of approximately the same extent. Symbol: a.
meanings_ja: これらは、存在する/関係にある
example: The students are studying. / 学生たちは勉強しています。

definition_en: (with the verb "to be") Present in the vicinity.
meanings_ja: その vicinity にあって
時間的に、状況的に、その周りを
example: I'll meet you around 5 pm. / 5時くらいに会いましょう。

definition_en: To such an extent or degree; to the same extent or degree.
example: I'll go to the store as soon as I finish this work. / 私はこの仕事を終わったら、まずスーパーに行く。

definition_en: To request (information, or an answer to a question).
example: What do you ask for in a gift? / おgiftについて何を尋ねるの？

definition_en: To reply to or talk to someone, either online or face-to-face. (from the practice of targeting a message or reply to someone online by writing @name)
example: I'll meet you at the station. / ステーションで会いましょう。

definition_en: The rear of the body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.
example: I need to go back to my hometown. / 私は故郷に戻らなくてはいけない。
The new restaurant will be open tomorrow. / 新しいレストランが明日開店します。

definition_en: A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae.
meanings_ja: 動物 (animal) - a large, carnivorous mammal
強化する (to endure) - to tolerate or put up with something unpleasant
example: I had to bear the pain all day. / 私は一日中の痛みを耐えた。

definition_en: For the reason (that).
example: I went to the party because I wanted to see my friends. / 私は友達に会いたいからパーティーに行った。

definition_en: To arrive, come (to a place).
meanings_ja: 変化する (for more nuanced changes)
example: I will become a teacher next year. / 私は来年、教師になる。

definition_en: A flying insect, of the clade Anthophila within the hymenopteran superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies (though only a minority have them), for collecting pollen and (in some species) producing wax and honey.
meanings_ja: いる/在る (to have existed or to have been in a particular state)
example: I've been studying English for three years. / 私は3年間英語を学んでいます。

definition_en: At an earlier time.
example: I'll call you before we leave. / 私たちは出発する前に君に電話します。

definition_en: To accept as true, particularly without absolute certainty (i.e., as opposed to knowing)
example: I believe in you. / 私はあなたを信じます。

definition_en: The supreme effort one can make, or has made.
meanings_ja: 一番良い (in a general or relative sense)
example: This is the best pizza I've ever had. / これは私生まれで最もおいしいピザです。

definition_en: An entity, usually animate, deemed superior to another; one who has a claim to precedence; a superior.
meanings_ja: 改善された、優れている
example: This new phone is better than my old one. / この新しい電話は、古い私のものよりも上等です。

definition_en: Someone or something that is large in stature
meanings_ja: 大きくないことのないもの
example: The big house is impressive. / 大きな家は印象的です。

definition_en: Any of various bladed or pointed hand weapons, originally designating an Anglo-Saxon sword, and later a weapon of infantry, especially in the 14th and 15th centuries, commonly consisting of a broad, heavy, double-edged, hook-shaped blade, with a short pike at the back and another at the top, attached to the end of a long staff.
meanings_ja: 取り寄せ物品の請求書
会計事務の帳票 (in a business or financial context)
example: I received a bill from my hotel. / ホテルから取り寄せ物品の請求書を受けました。

definition_en: The colour/color perceived in the absence of light, but also when no light is reflected, but rather absorbed.
example: The black car drove down the street. / 黒い自動車は通りを走った。

definition_en: A substantial, often approximately cuboid, piece of any substance.
meanings_ja: 分割された時間区間 (e.g. scheduling blocks)
example: The teacher gave us blocks of time to complete our assignments. / テーチャーは、私たちに作業を完了するための時間帯を与えた。

definition_en: A relatively long, wide and thin piece of any material, usually wood or similar, often for use in construction or furniture-making.
meanings_ja: ボードゲームの台 (for games like chess or Go)
example: The company's board of directors decided to launch a new product. / その会社の取締役会は、新製品を立ち上げることを決定した。

definition_en: Each of the two, or of the two kinds.
example: I like both coffee and tea. / 私はコーヒーとティーの両方が好きです。

definition_en: A young male.
example: The boy played outside. / この子供は外で遊んだ。

definition_en: The act or process by which something is built; construction.
example: I'm going to a building to meet my friend. / 私は友達と会うため建物に行く。

definition_en: A motor vehicle for transporting large numbers of people along roads.
example: I'm taking the bus to work. / 僕は路線バスで仕事に行く。

definition_en: An instance or example of using the word "but".
example: I wanted to go, but it was raining. / 私は行きたかったが、雨だった。

definition_en: A flying insect, of the clade Anthophila within the hymenopteran superfamily Apoidea, known for its organised societies (though only a minority have them), for collecting pollen and (in some species) producing wax and honey.
meanings_ja: ~から~まで (indicating a range or duration)
example: The company will be acquired by a new investor. / コーポレーションは、新しい投資家によって買収される。

meanings_ja: 太陽に恵まれた温暖な地域
example: I'm moving to California to pursue my dreams. / カリフォルニアに移り自分の夢を追跡します。

definition_en: A telephone conversation.
example: I'm going to call my friend later tonight / よる後、私の友達に電話する

definition_en: (heading) To use one's voice.
meanings_ja: 呼称される (additional meaning, less common)
example: The meeting was called at 2 PM. / 2時から会議が招集された。

definition_en: Used to indicate that the following event, period, or change in state occurred in the past, after a time of waiting, enduring, or anticipation
meanings_ja: 来た (as a verb, e.g. "I came to Japan")
example: I came to Tokyo yesterday. / 私は昨日東京に来た。

definition_en: (auxiliary verb, defective) To know how to; to be able to.
The process of becoming different.
example: I need to change my ticket before the deadline. / デッドライン前には、チケットを変更する必要があります。

definition_en: A person who has not yet reached adulthood, whether natural (puberty), cultural (initiation), or legal (majority)
example: The children were playing outside. / 小児は外に出て遊んでいた。

definition_en: An option; a decision; an opportunity to choose or select something.
example: I had a choice between A and B. / 私はAとBの選択をしていた。
"What's Chris's favorite hobby?" / 「クリスのお気に入りの趣味は何ですか？」

definition_en: To move from further away to nearer to.
meanings_ja: 来る、訪ねる (in the context of "visiting someone")
example: I'm coming to your party tonight. / 私は今夜あなたのパーティーに来ます。

definition_en: A team; a group of people who work together professionally.
meanings_ja: grupo (in a business sense, similar to "firm" or "corporation")
example: The company will expand its operations in Asia. / その企業はアジアでの営業を拡大する。

definition_en: A person employed to perform computations; one who computes.
meanings_ja: パーソナルコンピューター
example: I bought a new computer for my office. / 私は新しいパーソナルコンピューターをオフィスに購入しました。

definition_en: A person employed to perform computations; one who computes.
meanings_ja: コンピューターインフラストラクチャー（ITインフラ）
example: The company invested heavily in computers to improve productivity. / その会社は生産性を向上させるために多くのコンピューターを投資した。

definition_en: A moderate or refreshing state of cold; moderate temperature of the air between hot and cold; coolness.
example: The air-conditioned room was really cool. / エアコンの部屋はとてもすごかった。

definition_en: (auxiliary verb, defective) To know how to; to be able to.
example: I could run a marathon if I trained harder. / 私は訓練を積むとマラソンが走れる。

definition_en: To bring into existence; (sometimes in particular:)
meanings_ja: 生み出す (in a more abstract or artistic sense)
example: The artist creates beautiful paintings. / アーティストは美しい絵を描く。

definition_en: Abbreviation of declare.
meanings_ja: D（デシタル） - 数字の字頭
example: I'm going to download a new album, but it's only 4D. / 新アルバムをダウンロードするが、4Dしかない。

meanings_ja: パーソナルトレーナー
example: John and Dave are friends. / ジョンとデイブは友達です。

definition_en: Any period of 24 hours.
example: It's a beautiful day today! / 今日は美しい日です！

definition_en: (with "the") The deep part of a lake, sea, etc.
example: The ocean is deep. / 海は深い。

definition_en: (auxiliary) A syntactic marker.
example: I did my homework. / 私は宿題をやりました。

definition_en: A party, celebration, social function.
example: What do you want to do tonight? / 今晩は何をするつもりですか?

definition_en: A physician; a member of the medical profession; one who is trained and licensed to heal the sick or injured. The final examination and qualification may award a doctor degree in which case the post-nominal letters are D.O., DPM, M.D., DMD, DDS, in the US or MBBS in the UK.
meanings_ja: 医療用語で「医師」という意味もある (medical term for "physician")
example: The doctor's report showed... / ドクターの報告書は...

definition_en: (auxiliary) A syntactic marker.
example: She does yoga every morning. / 彼女は毎朝ヨガをする。
He doesn't like coffee. / 彼はコーヒーが嫌いです。

definition_en: (auxiliary) A syntactic marker.
example: I'm doing my homework. / 私は宿題をやっている。

definition_en: A university professor, particularly one at Oxford or Cambridge.
example: Can you don a hat? / あなたは帽子を着けますか?

definition_en: (auxiliary) A syntactic marker.
example: I'm done with my homework. / 私の宿題はできました。

definition_en: A portal of entry into a building, room, or vehicle, consisting of a rigid plane movable on a hinge. Doors are frequently made of wood or metal. May have a handle to help open and close, a latch to hold the door closed and a lock that ensures the door cannot be opened without the key.
example: The door to my apartment is always locked. / 私のアパートのドアは常に錠解けです。

definition_en: A portal of entry into a building, room, or vehicle, consisting of a rigid plane movable on a hinge. Doors are frequently made of wood or metal. May have a handle to help open and close, a latch to hold the door closed and a lock that ensures the door cannot be opened without the key.
example: The doors of the museum were open. / 博物館のドアが開いていた。

definition_en: A negative aspect; a downer.
example: The ball rolled down the hill. / 丸球は坂道を下ろした。

definition_en: A person or firm that owes money; one in debt; one who owes a debt
example: I'm going to the bar with my friends to grab a dr. / ぼくらは友達と_barにドリンクを買いに行く

definition_en: To consume (a liquid) through the mouth.
meanings_ja: うまれる (to drink a certain amount or to get drunk)
example: I'd like to drink some water. / 水を飲みたいです。

definition_en: A shift (scheduled work period) that takes place early in the day.
example: I have to finish my homework early tonight. / 私は今夜早く宿題を終わらせる必要があります。

definition_en: The third planet of the Solar System; the world upon which humans live.
example: The earth is our home. / 地球は我々の故郷です。

definition_en: Something that is easy
example: This task is easy. / このタスクはしたようです。

definition_en: The digit/figure 8.
example: I have eight books on my shelf. / 私のシェルフには八冊の本があります。
I will give you a present every year. / 年に一回、プレゼントをあなたにくれる。

definition_en: All the things under discussion.
example: I'm going to pack everything in my suitcase. / suitcaseにはすべてのものを詰める。

definition_en: An organ through which animals see (perceive surroundings via light).
example: She caught his eyes. / 彼の視線に嵐かった。

definition_en: A trading establishment, especially set up by merchants working in a foreign country.
example: The company owns a large factory in Tokyo. / 東京に大きな工場を所有しています。

definition_en: Distant; remote in space.
example: The hotel was far from the city center. / ホテルは市中心部から遠かった。

definition_en: Firmly or securely fixed in place; stable.
example: The new engine is faster, so it can get us to our destination sooner. / 新しいエンジンは速く、したがって हमの目的地に早く到着できます。

definition_en: A quality of an object experienced by touch.
example: I feel happy when I'm with my friends. / 私は、友達と一緒にいる時が楽しいと感じます。

definition_en: Few people, few things.
meanings_ja: 数少ない (for counting small numbers)
example: I have few friends who like playing soccer. / 私の友達はサッカーが好きな者が少ない。

definition_en: A land area free of woodland, cities, and towns; open country.
meanings_ja: ield (スポーツや競技のための)場所
example: The company will establish a new field office in Tokyo. / 会社は東京に新しい出張所を開設します。

definition_en: To contend in physical conflict, either singly or in war, battle etc.
example: I'm going to fight for my rights. / 私は自分の権利を闘いлянます。

definition_en: A thin layer of some substance; a pellicle; a membranous covering, causing opacity.
meanings_ja: 記録 (referring to film as a medium for recording)
example: I love watching films on Netflix. / 私はNetflixで映画を観るのを大好きです。

definition_en: An end; the end of anything.
example: I need to finish this project by Friday. / これらのプロジェクトを金曜日に終わらせなければ

definition_en: A (usually self-sustaining) chemical reaction involving the bonding of oxygen with carbon or other fuel, with the production of heat and the presence of flame or smouldering.
meanings_ja:
I'm happy to help! 😊

火 (hi)

* Meaning 1: 炉 (enjin), flames, or blaze
* Meaning 2: 火事 (kaji), a fire that occurs unexpectedly

例文: The fire department quickly put out the small fire. / 火消し部隊は小さな火事を早く消した。

Note: These translations capture the main meanings of the word "fire", which can refer to flames or blazes, as well as unexpected fires (e.g., an accident or natural disaster).
example: The fire department quickly put out the small fire. / 火消し部隊は小さな火事を早く消した。

definition_en: The person or thing in the first position.
example: The company's first project was a huge success. / その会社の最初のプロジェクトは大成功だった。
I'm working hard for my future. / 私は将来のために頑張っている。

definition_en: The digit or figure 4; an occurrence thereof.
meanings_ja: 4個の意味がある場合には、主要な意味を「四つ」と表現する。
example: I have four apples. / 私は四つのリンゴを持っています。

definition_en: A person other than a family member, spouse or lover whose company one enjoys and towards whom one feels affection.
example: I'm going to the party with my friends / 私は友人と一緒にパーティに行く

definition_en: Used to indicate source or provenance.
meanings_ja: ところから, 適切な場所から
example: I'm coming from Tokyo. / 東京から来ます。

definition_en: The time ahead; those moments yet to be experienced.
example: What is your future plan? / あなたの将来の計画は何ですか？

definition_en: A playful or competitive activity.
example: The new game is a lot of fun! / 新しい遊びは大好き！

definition_en: A playful or competitive activity.
meanings_ja: 遊び (play, as in board or card games)
example: I like playing games on my phone during breaks. / 私は休憩中の電話で遊戯を楽しむ。

definition_en: A near relative.
meanings_ja: ドイツ語、ドイツの (複数の意味あり)
example: The German engineer designed a new car. / ドイツ人の工程師は新しい自動車を設計した。

definition_en: Offspring.
meanings_ja: 取得する (to acquire or obtain something)
example: I'll get a coffee at the corner shop. / コーヒーを角の店で買う。

definition_en: (ditransitive) To obtain; to acquire.
meanings_ja: 手にとる, 取り柄にする
example: I'm getting tired from this long journey. / これ長い旅の疲れです。

definition_en: A being such as a monotheistic God: a single divine creator and ruler of the universe.
meanings_ja: 上手な人 (for "god" as in a very skilled person)
example: The gods of Olympus were powerful. / オリンピスの神々は強大であった。

definition_en: The act of going.
meanings_ja: 始まる、始まるところ (in a sense of starting or beginning)
example: He goes to school every day. / 彼は毎日学校に行く。

definition_en: To move:
example: I'm going to Tokyo tomorrow. / 明日、東京に行きます。

definition_en: (of people)
example: This restaurant has a good reputation. / このレストランは高い評判です。

definition_en: To become larger, to increase in magnitude.
example: The child will grow up to be a great scientist. / 子供は偉大な科学者に成長する。

definition_en: An effigy of a man burned on a bonfire on the anniversary of the Gunpowder Plot (5th November).
example: Hey, guys! How was your day? / ヒー、男男性たち！あなたの日は何されたの？

definition_en: (chiefly Internet slang) Used as a filler response when one does not have a response to use. Almost always used by itself.
example: The h in the piano is out of tune. / ピアノのhは音程が悪い。

definition_en: To possess, own.
example: I had a great time at the party. / パーティーに行った時はすごく楽しかった。

definition_en: A corridor; a hallway.
meanings_ja: 屋内広場 (for a large public hall or a hallway)
example: The concert hall was packed with excited fans. / コンサートの会場は、激しいファンの群れで満員だった。

definition_en: The part of the forelimb below the forearm or wrist in a human, and the corresponding part in many other animals.
meanings_ja: 構成員 (in a team or organization)
example: I'll take it by hand. /私はその手をとってください。

definition_en: A happy event, thing, person, etc.
example: I'm happy to be going on vacation. / 休みに行くのが最高です。

definition_en: A firm or paved beach or slope convenient for hauling vessels out of the water.
meanings_ja: 難しい、苦しい (additional meanings include "firm" or "solid", but these two are more common)
example: I have to work hard every day. / 私は毎日働かなければならない。

definition_en: To possess, own.
example: He has a car. / 彼は自動車を持っている。

definition_en: A wealthy or privileged person.
meanings_ja: 行う、経験する (in the sense of "to have an experience")
example: I will have a meeting with my boss tomorrow. / 明日はボ Bossと会議を持つ。

definition_en: The game of tag, or it, in which the player attempting to catch the others is called "he".
example: He is a good person. / 彼はいい人です。

definition_en: The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.
meanings_ja: 首領、代表 (in a figurative sense, e.g. "the head of the company")
example: The head of the department is responsible for all decisions. / 部局長はすべての決断に責任を持つ。

definition_en: Enjoying health and vigor of body, mind, or spirit: well.
example: I try to eat healthy foods every day. /私は毎日健康な食材を食べます。

definition_en: (stative) To perceive sounds through the ear.
example: Can you hear me now? / 今話してほしいですか?

definition_en: "Hello!" or an equivalent greeting.
example: Hello, how are you? / お元気ですか？

definition_en: Action given to provide assistance; aid.
example: Can you help me with this task? / 私のこのタスクに手伝ってくれてありがとう!

definition_en: A female person or animal.
example: She smiled at her. / 彼女は彼女に笑ってくれた。

definition_en: (abstract) This place; this location.
example: I'll meet you here at 5 o'clock. / ５時、ここで会いましょう。

definition_en: An exclamation to get attention.
meanings_ja: こんにちは (konnichiwa) - casual greeting, similar to "hello" or "hi"
イエイ (iee!) - informal way to get someone's attention, like "hey" in a more casual setting
example: Hey, how are you? / イエイ、どっちです？

definition_en: Honorific alternative letter-case form of his, sometimes used when referring to God or another important figure who is understood from context.
meanings_ja: その男の (in reference to a specific person)
example: His car is very old. / 彼の自動車は非常に古い。

definition_en: To want something to happen, with a sense of expectation that it might.
meanings_ja: 将来の良い結果を望む
example: I have hope that the situation will improve. / 私は状況が良くなることを期待しています。

definition_en: The means by which something is accomplished.
example: How did you get here? / ここに来たのはどのようにしたのですか?

definition_en: The name of the Latin-script letter I.
example: "What's your favorite color, I?" / ""

definition_en: An abstract archetype of a given thing, compared to which real-life examples are seen as imperfect approximations; pure essence, as opposed to actual examples.
example: I had a great idea for a new business. / 私は新しいビジネスについてのイデアがありました。

definition_en: An uncertainty, possibility, condition, doubt etc.
example: If it rains, we will take an umbrella. / かかり雨がある場合、我々は傘を持つ。

definition_en: A position of power or influence, or a way to get it.
meanings_ja: の中で (in a certain context or situation)

example: Can you tell me more about that? Uh, let me think for a moment. / あのことをもっと教えてください？何か、思う時間くれます。

definition_en: A particular, minute unit of mass, defined differently for different substances, but so that varying substances of the same general type have the property that one international unit of the one has the same effect on the human body as one international unit of the other.
meanings_ja: 組織 (in this context, a unit refers to a organizational entity)
example: The company has several units in different countries. / その会社は異なる国々に複数の組織を持っています。

definition_en: The act of using.
example: The new software uses advanced algorithms. / 新しいソフトウェアは高度なアルゴリズムを使用します。

definition_en: To utilize or employ.
example: I'm using my phone to take a picture. / 私は電話で写真を撮影しています。

definition_en: An elongated depression between hills or mountains, often with a river flowing through it.
meanings_ja: 谷間地帯 (natural valley), 都市の谷 (urban valley)
example: The hikers followed the trail through the beautiful river valley. / 河川谷を歩くトレイルをフォローした。

definition_en: The quality (positive or negative) that renders something desirable or valuable.
meanings_ja: 優先順位 (in a decision-making process)
example: The company places great value on employee satisfaction. / 会社は従業員の満足に大きな價値を置く。

definition_en: Something complete, without any parts missing.
meanings_ja: 完全な, 一緒にした
example: The whole team worked together to complete the project. / みんなで協力してプロジェクトを完成しました。

definition_en: Outside, externally. This is still used in the names of some civil parishes in England, e.g. St Cuthbert Without.
example: I'm going to the party without you. / 私は君がいてもパーティーに行く。

definition_en: To be affected with surprise or admiration; to be struck with astonishment; to be amazed; to marvel; often followed by at.
example: I wondered what she was doing there. / 彼女がそこ何をしていたのか疑問した。

definition_en: A person who performs labor for a living, especially manual labor.
example: The company hired many workers to finish the project. / 会社はプロジェクトを完了するために多くの職員を雇用した。

definition_en: A person who performs labor for a living, especially manual labor.
example: The company hired many workers to build a new factory. / その会社は新しい工場を建てため多くの募人を雇用した。

definition_en: Value.
example: This new phone is worth $500. / この新しいスマホは5万円値がある。

definition_en: (usually with negative) Thus far; up to the present; up to some specified time; still
meanings_ja: まだ（まだ始まっていない）
ただし、しかし（条件や否定を表す）
example: I've never been to Paris yet, but I hope to go soon. / 私はパリに一度も行ったことがないが、すぐに行くことを希望しています。

definition_en: The numeric symbol that represents the cardinal number zero.
example: The company's zero emissions goal is ambitious. / その零の排気目標はambitiousです。
The adcock was used in the baseball game. / 野球ゲームでアドックが使われました。

meanings_ja: アニメやゲームのイベント
example: The aganza in the anime was exciting! / アニメではアガンザがとてもドキドキだった！

definition_en: Having a muscular physique
example: The analyst's bullish report boosted the stock market. / 分析家の報告が株式市場を上昇させることになった。
The cubric structure was used in ancient civilizations. / 古代文明では、関係的な構造が使われた。

meanings_ja: せんべい (Demerara sugar is a type of brown sugar)
none (since there are no other common meanings)
example: The recipe called for Demerara sugar to give the cake a rich flavor. / そのレシピでは、せんべいを使用してケーキの味を深めるようにいた。
The company denovo developed a new marketing strategy. / 会社は新しいマーキングストラテジーを新規に開発した。

meanings_ja: renraku shinri gakusha () - experts in ethics and morality
example: The ethicists debated whether cloning was morally justifiable. / moraigaku gakusha wa jinkou no shingan ni taiou o ronshita.
The extrav show was amazing. / その外出ショーはすごかった。

definition_en: A demonstration of respect, such as towards an individual after their retirement or death
example: The artist received homage for his groundbreaking work. / アーティストは、彼の先人的な作品に対して崇拝を受けた。

definition_en: One who or that which cannot be satiated.
meanings_ja: 諦に達することなく続く (特に感情や要求)
example: She has an insatiable appetite for adventure. / 彼女は冒険に対して食欲のない。

definition_en: Causing ill will, envy, or offense.
example: The new policy is invidious because it favors one group over others. / その新しい政策は、一群を優先して他のグループを不公平に扱うため不公平である。

meanings_ja: フランク・クベルト（Frank Frazetta）
クローズアップ写真のスタイル（close-up photography style）
example: The comic book was inspired by Frank Kubert. / コミックブックはフランク・クベルトにインスパイアされた。
The famous Polish dancer Malikowski wowed the audience with his choreography. / Malikowskiは著名なポーランドの舞踏家で、彼のコレオグラフィーに観客を魅了した。

definition_en: A rich or powerful person; a magnate.
meanings_ja: スキー・スノーボードのパイオニア (in the context of skiing or snowboarding)
example: The tech mogul founded a successful startup. / 技術の強力なビジネスマンは成功したスタートアップを設立しました。

definition_en: Ten thousand; 10,000
example: The city has a myriad of restaurants to choose from. / この街にはいくつかのレストランがあります。

definition_en: An extended adventurous voyage.
meanings_ja: 大きな挑戦 (in terms of emotional or intellectual journey)
example: He embarked on an odyssey to find his true passion. / 彼は自分の真の目的に長い旅程を始めた。

definition_en: To turn on an exact spot.
meanings_ja: トルクを加えて方向を変えた
example: The company pivoted its strategy after losing key investors. / 企業は投資家が失われたため、戦略を軸に寄せて再構築した。

definition_en: An original form or object which is a basis for other forms or objects (particularly manufactured items), or for its generalizations and models.
example: We built a prototype of the new smartphone. / 新スマートフォンの試作物を作りました。

definition_en: Any very large number, exceeding normal description.
example: The number of stars in the universe is estimated to be quadrillions. / 宇宙の星は、約10^15個あると推定される。

definition_en: A scoundrel, rascal or unprincipled, deceitful, and unreliable person.
meanings_ja: 非常に奇妙な者 (also means "unusual" or "strange")
example: The rogue trader was caught. / 不良な取引商が捕まりました。

definition_en: In sequence, in order.
example: The instructions should be followed sequentially. / インストラクションは連続的に従ってください。

meanings_ja: スナイダー銃の製作者
sniper（狙撃手）を意味することもある
example: The company was founded by John Snider, who invented the snider rifle. / スニダー銃を発明したジョン・スニダーによって設立された企業はあります。

definition_en: Collectively, those layers of the Earth’s crust which primarily comprise stratified deposits.
example: The spacecraft entered the stratosphere and began to descend. / 宇宙船は上層大気に到達し、降下を始めた。

definition_en: To pass beyond the limits of something.
meanings_ja: 導く、超越する (in a philosophical or spiritual sense)
example: The artist's work transcended mere decoration, revealing deeper truths. / そのアートワークは、ただ装飾を超えてより深い真理を表した。

definition_en: Of, pertaining to or leading to transformation
example: The company underwent a transformational change to become more competitive. / その会社は競争力強化のために大きな変革を迎えた。

definition_en: To promote or advantage.
example: The company has advanced technology to develop new products. / その会社は新しい製品を開発するための高度な技術を持っています。

definition_en: To fill with wonder and surprise; to astonish, astound, surprise or perplex.
example: I was amazed by the fireworks display. / ボーカルコンサートの演出を驚異した。

definition_en: An annual publication; a book, periodical, journal, report, comic book, yearbook, etc., which is published serially once a year, which may or may not be in addition to regular weekly or monthly publication.
meanings_ja: ประจำปี, 毎年限りの
example: The company's annual report is due next month. / その会社の年度報告書は、来月期限です。

definition_en: The act of applying or laying on, in a literal sense
meanings_ja: アプリケーションソフトウェア (computing context)
example: I need to submit my application by Friday. / 金曜日に申請を提出する必要があります。

definition_en: The art and science of designing and managing the construction of buildings and other structures, particularly if they are well proportioned and decorated.
example: The new architecture of the company will improve efficiency. / その会社の新しい建築は効率を改善する。

definition_en: Man-made; of artifice.
example: The artificial lake was built for recreation. / 人為的に建てられた湖は遊び目的で作られた。

definition_en: A helpful action or an act of giving.
meanings_ja: 支援する (in a broader sense, e.g., "to assist someone in need")
example: Can you assist me with this task? / 買い物を手伝ってください。

definition_en: A long-term respiratory condition, in which the airways may unexpectedly and suddenly narrow, often in response to an allergen, cold air, exercise, or emotional stress. Symptoms include wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, and coughing.
example: I have asthma, so I always carry an inhaler with me. / 私はアスタマを患っていて、常にインハレイザーを持っております。

definition_en: The action of trying at something.
example: I will attempt to solve the puzzle. / 私はパズルの解を尻试します。

definition_en: A berry.
example: The boat sailed into the bay. / 舟は湾に乗り入れた。

definition_en: Mental acceptance of a claim as true.
example: I have a strong belief in the power of education. / 教育の力に強く信じています。

definition_en: The unknown.
example: The new restaurant is beyond the city center. / この新しいレストランは市中心より超過する。

definition_en: (modern British & Australian, short scale) a thousand million (logic: 1,000 × 1,000^2): 1 followed by nine zeros, 109; a milliard
meanings_ja: 巨大な規模（例えば、企業の売り上げなど）
example: The company's profits are in the billions. / その企業の利益は100億以上です。
The sky was a beautiful bl blue today. / 今日は非常にブルーの空だった。

definition_en: To determine the value of something or the solution to something by a mathematical process.
example: I need to calculate my expenses for the trip. / 私の旅行費用を計算する必要がある。

definition_en: The grounds or property of a school, college, university, business, church, or hospital, often understood to include buildings and other structures.
example: The campus was bustling with students. / 校内は学生たちが賑わっていた。

definition_en: A disease in which the cells of a tissue undergo uncontrolled (and often rapid) proliferation.
meanings_ja: がん (gan) - general term for cancer diseases
example: I was diagnosed with lung cancer. / Tôi wa rūn gankyō to katarareta.

definition_en: The ability to hold, receive or absorb
meanings_ja: 容量、容積 (in a physical sense)
example: The company has the capacity to produce 1000 units per month. / その会社は月に1000個の製品を生産できる能力を持つ。
I'm moving to North Carolina this summer. / 私は今年夏にノースカロライナに引越すつもりです。

definition_en: Precept or warning against evil or danger of any kind; exhortation to wariness; advice; injunction; prudence in regard to danger; provident care
example: Be cautious when crossing the street. / 街道を渡る際は注意してください。

definition_en: A rite or ceremony.
meanings_ja: 星人 (in a figurative sense, meaning someone who is highly regarded or admired)
example: She's a celebrity chef in the US. / アメリカでは有名なシェフです。

definition_en: A small piece broken from a larger piece of solid material.
meanings_ja: 電子決済 (in a financial context)
example: I bought a new phone with a chip. / 私は新しい電話を小片で購入した。

definition_en: That which attends, or relates to, or in some way affects, a fact or event; an attendant thing or state of things.
meanings_ja: 玉の状態 (in the case of a gemstone)
example: The company's financial circumstances were dire, so they had to lay off many employees. / 会社の財務状況は非常に厳しくて、多くの従業員を解雇する必要があった。
The art museum features a stunning painting by Clara. / クラーラーの絵画作品を鑑賞する博物館がある。

definition_en: The act of comparing or the state or process of being compared.
meanings_ja: 等価の設定 (in a broader sense)
example: The company made comparisons between different products before deciding which one to buy. / その会社は異なる製品を比較して購入することを決めた。

definition_en: To bring into existence; (sometimes in particular:)
meanings_ja: 生み出す (for creating something new)
example: The artist is creating a new sculpture. / 芸術家は新しい彫刻を作り上げている。

definition_en: Something created such as an invention or artwork.
meanings_ja: 創造物 (主要な意味：創造神話や芸術作品など)
example: The museum's latest creation is a stunning sculpture. / ミュージアムの最新作は素晴らしい彫刻です。

definition_en: Something created such as an invention or artwork.
example: The artist's creations were highly praised by critics. / 芸術家の作品は批評家たちから高く評価された。

definition_en: (plural: data) A measurement of something on a scale understood by both the recorder (a person or device) and the reader (another person or device). The scale is arbitrarily defined, such as from 1 to 10 by ones, 1 to 100 by 0.1, or simply true or false, on or off, yes, no, or maybe, etc.
example: The company needs to collect more data on customer preferences. / その会社は、顧客の嗜好に関する情報を集めなくてはいけない。

definition_en: A group, set, or series of ten , particularly:
example: It's been decades since I last saw my friends. / 私は友達と最近十数年の間会っていません。

definition_en: To overcome in battle or contest.
meanings_ja: 打ち負ける (in a competition or game)
example: The team felt defeated after losing the championship. / チームは優勝を逃げて失望感を持った。

definition_en: To set free from restraint or danger.
example: The package was delivered yesterday. / パッケージは昨日手渡された。

definition_en: The desire to purchase goods and services.
example: The company received a demand for better working conditions. / その会社はよりよい勤務条件の請求を受けた。

definition_en: To be entitled to, as a result of past actions; to be worthy to have.
meanings_ja: 優秀な結果を得るに値する
適切な報酬や評価を受けるに値する
example: She worked hard and deserved the promotion. / 彼女は努力して昇進を貢献した。

definition_en: To plan and carry out (a picture, work of art, construction etc.).
example: The new smartphone was designed to be user-friendly. / 新しいスマートフォンは、ユーザーフレンドリーに作成された。

definition_en: To plan and carry out (a picture, work of art, construction etc.).
meanings_ja: 企画する (in the context of planning or conceptualizing)
example: The company is designing a new product line. / 会社は新製品ラインを設計しています。

definition_en: To change with a specific direction, progress.
meanings_ja: 新しい計画やアイデアを実現するための調整中の
example: The company is developing a new product. / 会社は新製品を開発中です。

definition_en: The process of developing; growth, directed change.
meanings_ja: 新しいシステムの導入 (new system introduction)
example: The company invested heavily in the development of a new software. / その会社は新しいソフトウェアの開発に大きな投資を費やした。

definition_en: A digital option.
meanings_ja: デジタル化された, 数字化された
example: The company is going digital to improve its customer service. / その会社は、顧客サービスの向上のためにデジタル化を進めている。

definition_en: Something discovered.
example: NASA made a discovery about water on Mars. / NASAはマーズに水があることを発見した。

definition_en: An abnormal condition of a human, animal or plant that causes discomfort or dysfunction; distinct from injury insofar as the latter is usually instantaneously acquired.
example: Many people suffer from diseases like diabetes and cancer. / 多くの人は糖尿病やがんのような疾患に苦しみます。

definition_en: A machine for washing dishes.
example: I'm tired of doing the dishes, can we use the dishwasher? / 私は食器洗浄を疲れました、dishwasherを使うことができますか？

definition_en: Disbelief or uncertainty (about something); a particular instance of such disbelief or uncertainty.
example: I had my doubts about her abilities, but she proved me wrong. / 彼女の能力に対して疑念を持っていたが、実際には誤りだった。

definition_en: To provide an impetus for motion or other physical change, to move an object by means of the provision of force thereto.
meanings_ja: 適切な方法で進行する
example: I was driven by a desire to succeed. / 私は成功したいという欲求に動機づけられました。

definition_en: To gain (success, reward, recognition) through applied effort or work.
example: I earned a bonus by completing my project on time. / プロジェクトを間に合って賞与された。

definition_en: An electrical engineer.
example: The new electrical outlet in my house is very convenient. / 我家の新しい電気の出力がとても便利です。

definition_en: A person who is qualified or professionally engaged in any branch of engineering.
example: The company hired many engineers to develop new products. / その会社は新製品を開発するために多くの技術者を雇用した。

definition_en: (stative) to be; have existence; have being or reality
example: The ancient civilization existed long before modern times. / 古代文明は非常に古くから存在していた。

definition_en: To change (something) from a smaller form and/or size to a larger one; to spread out or lay open.
meanings_ja: 開示する (in a business or academic context)
example: The company plans to expand its operations into new markets. / その会社は新しい市場に拡大する計画をしている。

definition_en: To increase in extent.
meanings_ja: 延びる, 拡張する (for physical or spatial extensions)
example: The company extends its services to rural areas. / その会社は農村地域にサービスを拡張しています。

definition_en: Anything that goes beyond what is ordinary.
example: This concert was extraordinary! / このコンサートは並大なだった!

definition_en: To start (an institution or organization).
example: The company was founded by a group of entrepreneurs. / その会社は起業家のグループによって設立された。

definition_en: A part of a whole, especially a comparatively small part.
example: The fraction of students who passed was very high. / 学生たちの合格率は非常に高かった。

definition_en: What something does or is used for.
meanings_ja: 関数、演算子 (in mathematics or programming)
example: The new software has a function to automatically back up files. / 新しいソフトウェアにはファイル自動バックアップの機能があります。

definition_en: The state or characteristic of being good.
example: She demonstrated her goodness by helping those in need. / 彼女は困っている人々を助けることで彼女のいいところを示した。

definition_en: The making of architectural or design drawings.
meanings_ja: コンピュータグラフィックス (computer graphics)
example: The company creates stunning graphics for their new product launch. / その会社は新製品の発売に際してストunningなビジュアルデザインを創作しています。

definition_en: The military installation from which troops are commanded and orders are issued; the military unit consisting of a commander and his support staff.
example: The company's headquarters is located in Tokyo. / 東京の本社が所在する。
The idea of hell is a powerful motivator. / 地獄の概念は強いモチベーターです。

definition_en: Payment for the temporary use of something.
meanings_ja: 使用する (to use something, especially for a short time)
example: I hired a car for the weekend. /私は週末に自動車を借りました。

definition_en: To want something to happen, with a sense of expectation that it might.
example: I'm hoping to see you soon. / またすぐ会いにと思います。

definition_en: An amount by which a quantity is increased.
example: The company's profits will increase this year. / 今年この会社の利益は増加する。

definition_en: (19th-mid 20th century) An employee in industry.
example: The city has an industrial area. / この都市には産業地区があります。

definition_en: The tendency to work persistently. Diligence.
example: The industry is growing rapidly. / 産業は急速に成長しています。

definition_en: At once; without delay.
example: I'll help you instantly. / 私はすぐに助けます。

definition_en: Capacity of mind, especially to understand principles, truths, facts or meanings, acquire knowledge, and apply it to practice; the ability to comprehend and learn.
example: The company is looking for someone with high intelligence to lead the project. / その会社はプロジェクトをリードするための高精度の人の探しをしています。

definition_en: Strained; tightly drawn.
example: The intense heat made it difficult to stay outside. / 強烈な暑さで外に出るのは困難だった。

definition_en: To design a new process or mechanism.
meanings_ja: 発見された (as a noun, referring to something discovered or found)
example: The company invented a new product. / その会社は新しい製品を作り出してきた。

meanings_ja: 古くはコンスタンティノープルの称号を持つ都市
example: I'm planning to visit Istanbul next year. / 今年からイスタンブールに旅行に行きます。

definition_en: To strike for admittance; to rap upon, as a door.
meanings_ja: 窓のドアを叩く (mainly in this sense)
example: I heard knocking on the door. / ドアに音を打つことが聞こえた。

definition_en: A laboratory.
example: The scientist worked in her lab all night to meet the deadline. / 科学者は、期限を超えるために夜中の研究室で働きました。

definition_en: Effort expended on a particular task; toil, work.
example: The company values its employees' labor and provides good working conditions. / その会社は従業員の労働を評価して、良好な職場環境を提供する。

definition_en: To throw (a projectile such as a lance, dart or ball); to hurl; to propel with force.
meanings_ja: 発売された (in the context of a product or service)
example: The company launched its new marketing campaign last week. / その会社は最近の週に新しいマーケティングキャンペーンをスタートした。

definition_en: Having light; bright; clear; not dark or obscure.
meanings_ja: 小型の照明具 (in aviation or camping context)
example: I brought a lighter to help me start my campfire. / キャンプファイヤーを始めるのにスモーキングツールを持って行きました。

definition_en: Someone who makes; a person or thing that makes or produces something.
meanings_ja: 製作者 (in a technical or industrial context)
example: The new software maker is working on a game-changing project. / 新しいソフトウェアの作成者がゲームチェンジングのプロジェクトを進めている。

definition_en: Someone who has control over something or someone.
example: The company is led by masters of innovation. / その会社はイノベーションの専門家に率いられている。
Microsoft is a leading software company. / マイクロソフトは主なソフトウェア企業です。

definition_en: A mental or emotional state, composure.
example: The movie's mood was somber, reflecting the characters' grief. / その映画の気分は葵傷に満ちていた。

definition_en: Adjacent, near, close by
example: The hotel is nearby, so we can walk to the restaurant. / ホテルは近くにあるため、レストランに歩いて行ける。

definition_en: And not (introducing a negative statement, without necessarily following one).
example: I won't go to the party nor will my friends / 私はパーティに行くことも友達も行かない

definition_en: (of a function) Assuming each of the values in its codomain; having its range equal to its codomain.
meanings_ja: その場所に、そこに (指向的・方向的な意味)
example: The cat jumped onto the table. / 猫はテーブルの上に跳ねた。

definition_en: As it was in the beginning.
example: I met her originally from Tokyo. / 東京から出会った。

definition_en: A set of clothing (with accessories).
meanings_ja: セット、ユニット (in a technical or organizational sense)
example: She wore a stylish outfit to the party. / 彼女はパーティーにスタイルの良い服装を身に付けました。

definition_en: With perfection.
example: She sang perfectly in tune. / 彼女は完全に和音を歌った。

definition_en: One who performs for, or entertains, an audience.
example: The performer took the stage and began to dance. / パフォーマーはステージに立ち舞始めた。

definition_en: To design (a building, machine, etc.).
example: I had planned to go to Tokyo next week, but now I'm going to Beijing instead. / 東京行きを計画していたが、北京に行くことにした。

definition_en: To provide power for (a mechanical or electronic device).
example: The car is powered by electricity. / 電気で動く自動車です。

definition_en: A prediction.
meanings_ja: 予言する, 献予する (additional meanings)
example: The scientist's model can predict the weather pattern. / 科学者のモデルは天気パターンを予測する。

definition_en: An advantage of something, especially when contrasted with its disadvantages (cons).
example: The new policy is designed to be pro-consumer. / 新しい政策は消費者に有利に設計された。

definition_en: A series of events which produce a result (the product).
meanings_ja: 物理過程, 制作過程 (in this case, it refers to a series of steps or stages in manufacturing)
example: The company streamlined its production process to increase efficiency. / 会社は生産手順を簡素化して効率性を上げた。

definition_en: Capable of producing something, especially in abundance; fertile.
example: The new system has been very productive, increasing efficiency by 30%. / 新システムは非常に効率的で、30%の生産性向上を実現しました。

definition_en: Movement or advancement through a series of events, or points in time; development through time.
example: We've made progress on our project. / 私達はプロジェクトでの進歩を遂げました。

definition_en: To commit to (some action or outcome), or to assure (a person) of such commitment; to make an oath or vow.
meanings_ja: 将来の大成あり (in a more formal or professional context)
example: This young artist is very promising. / この若いアーティストは非常に有望です。

definition_en: Any of numerous large, complex naturally-produced molecules composed of one or more long chains of amino acids, in which the amino acid groups are held together by peptide bonds.
meanings_ja: プロテイン - a type of biological molecule
example: The protein in milk is good for your health. / 牛乳のプロテインはあなたの健康にいいです。

definition_en: To apply a force to (an object) such that it moves away from the person or thing applying the force.
example: I'm pushing myself to finish this project on time. / 私は、プロジェクトを間に合わせるために自分自身を激しく努力しています。

definition_en: To place something somewhere.
example: I've been putting off my homework until tonight. / 私は今夜までhomeworkを後回ししてきました。

definition_en: Level of excellence.
example: The company values honesty and transparency as its core qualities. / その会社は、onestyとtransparencyを基本的な性質として評価する。

definition_en: With speed; in a rapid manner.
example: The company is expanding rapidly. / その会社は急速に拡大しています。

definition_en: To cause one to experience a memory (of someone or something); to bring to the notice or consideration (of a person).
example: I was reminded to buy milk when I saw the ad. / アドを見た時、牛乳を買うことを思い出された。

definition_en: What somebody is known for.
example: She worked hard to improve her reputation as a skilled engineer. / 彼女は自分が優秀な技術者としての評価を高めるために努力した。

definition_en: To ask for (something).
example: The customer requested a refund. / 顧客は還付を頼みかけてきました。

definition_en: One who researches.
example: The researchers studied the effects of climate change on wildlife. / 気候変化の影響を研究する科学者は、野生生物の影響について調査した。

definition_en: A political upheaval in a government or nation state characterized by great change.
example: The American Revolution was a major turning point in world history. / アメリカ革命は世界史上の大きな転換点だった。

definition_en: A possible adverse event or outcome
example: The company is willing to take a risk on this new project. / その新しいプロジェクトに賭けて会社は危険を負う。

definition_en: Dangerous, involving risks.
example: The investment was too risky, so I decided to play it safe. / 投資はやみつきだったため、安全な選択をしてしまった。

definition_en: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.
example: The robot helped me with my chores. / ロボットは私に家事を手伝った。

definition_en: A machine built to carry out some complex task or group of tasks by physically moving, especially one which can be programmed.
meanings_ja: 作業・検査を自動化する機器
example: The robots are used in manufacturing to assemble parts. / 製造で部品を組み立てるロボットが使用される。

definition_en: To cause to revolve by turning over and over; to move by turning on an axis; to impel forward by causing to turn over and over on a supporting surface.
example: The dough was rolled into a ball. / つがねいた球になった。

definition_en: Causing or able to cause fright.
example: The haunted house was the scariest place I've ever been. / 私が経験した中で最も怖い場所はHaunted Houseでした。

definition_en: To give part of what one has to somebody else to use or consume.
meanings_ja: 共有する, 共通する
example: We shared a car to go to the party. / パーティーに行くために車を分かち合った。

definition_en: A person's name, written by that person, used as identification or to signify approval of accompanying material, such as a legal contract.
meanings_ja: 特徴的なスタイルや方法
example: The artist's signature brushstrokes are recognizable. / そのアーティストの署名は認識できる。

definition_en: To make a mark
meanings_ja: 承認された (in a commercial or official sense)
example: The contract was signed in 2010. / 2010年に契約書は署名された。

definition_en: Encoded computer instructions, usually modifiable (unless stored in some form of unalterable memory such as ROM).
meanings_ja: プログラム、プログラミング
example: I need to update my software. / 私のソフトウェアをアップデートする必要があります。

definition_en: A homogeneous mixture, which may be liquid, gas or solid, formed by dissolving one or more substances.
example: The company found a solution to their financial problems. / その会社は財政問題に解決をみつけた。

definition_en: An injured, infected, inflamed or diseased patch of skin.
example: I've got a sore finger from playing soccer. / サッカーで指が痛くなった。

definition_en: A general type.
example: I will sort these papers by category. / これらの書類を分類しておく。

definition_en: A vehicle that flies through space.
example: The spaceship landed safely on the moon. / ザースペースシップは月面に安全に着陸した。

definition_en: A distinguishing attribute or quality.
meanings_ja: 具体的な (in context of scientific or technical usage)

definition_en: A principle or example or measure used for comparison.
example: The company has high standards for its products. / その会社は商品について高く高い基準を持っています。

meanings_ja: スタンダード（Standard） - in a broader sense, referring to something that meets standard or expected quality
example: I bought a Stanley thermos for my daily coffee. / スタンリーの熱-insulatedボトルを購入しました。

definition_en: A declaration or remark.
example: The company made a statement about its new product. / 会社は新製品についての公式声明を発表した。

definition_en: A store or supply.
meanings_ja: 社員 (shaain) - This refers to the company's employees.
流通品 (ryūtsūhin) - This refers to goods or products that are in stock.
example: The company has a large stock of skilled engineers. / その会社には優秀な技術者が多い社員があります。

definition_en: A cohesive whole built up of distinct parts.
meanings_ja: 建物やシステムの構造
社会的・文化的な組織体系
example: The new skyscraper has a unique structure. / 新しい高層ビルはユニークな構造を持つ。

definition_en: Technology
example: Can you send me some tech on the new product? / あの新製品に関する技術情報を送ってください。

definition_en: To challenge.
meanings_ja: 試験 (主に学校や資格試験の意味)、テスト (コンピューターソフトウェアの意味)
example: The company is testing a new product. / その会社は新製品を検査中です。

definition_en: Confidence in or reliance on some person or quality.
example: I trust you with my secrets. / 私はあなたに秘密を任せてある。

definition_en: Either of two people (or, less commonly, animals) who shared the same uterus at the same time; one who was born at the same birth as a sibling.
example: I have a twin sister. / 私は双子の姉妹をいます。

definition_en: An expression used to show contentment for something
example: "I'm not sure if I'll go to the party. Um, let me think about it." / "行くか否かはわからない。ううん、ちょっと考える必要がある"

definition_en: Our universe, the sum of everything that exists in the cosmos, including time and space itself.
example: The universe is full of mysteries. / 宇宙は謎に満ちている。

definition_en: A submicroscopic, non-cellular structure consisting of a core of DNA or RNA surrounded by a protein coat, that requires a living host cell to replicate, and often causes disease in the host organism.
meanings_ja: 病原体 (mainly referring to biological viruses)
example: A computer virus was spreading rapidly online. / パソコンウイルスが急速にオンラインで広がっていた。

definition_en: The sense or ability of sight.
example: My vision is to become a successful entrepreneur. / 私の目標は、成功した起業家になることです。

definition_en: To make (someone) aware of (something impending); especially:
example: The warning sign said "Danger" in red letters. / 赤文字の「危険」の警告看板を目にする

definition_en: A strong feeling of anxiety.
meanings_ja: 懸念、不安 (in a broader sense)
example: I've had worries about my exam, but I'll be fine. / 私の試験について心配がありましたが、問題ありません。

definition_en: As can be supported or proven by sound logical deduction, evidence, and precedent.
example: The new policy is arguably a step in the right direction. / 新しい政策は、議論の余地がありながらも、適切な方向に向かっているstepである。

definition_en: A decorated cloth hung at the back of a stage.
meanings_ja: 支持者、後盾（social or economic support）
example: The concert featured a dramatic backdrop of fireworks. / コンサートは火花のあるドラマティックな背景を持った。

definition_en: To perform the religious act of the baptism, to baptise.
meanings_ja: キリスト教徒の聖餐受容
example: The baby was christened John. / 赤ちゃんはジョンと名前を付けられた。

definition_en: A medical student's session spent in a real-world nursing environment.
meanings_ja: 療養的な (in a medical context)
example: The doctor's clinical skills were impressive. / 彼の医療的なスキルは印象的だった。

definition_en: To drive together, round up
meanings_ja: 強い印象を与える（to leave a strong impression）
example: The new movie was compelling, and I couldn't take my eyes off the screen. / 新しい映画は面白かったため、私はスクリーンを見つめ続けました。
The company is at the forefront of cutting-edge technology in robotics. / その会社はロボティクス分野で最先端の技術を開発しています。

definition_en: Directed vertically; coming straight down.
meanings_ja: 完全に (~) - This translates to a strong sense of something being entirely or completely true.
本当に (~) - This conveys a sense of honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
example: "He's a downright honest person." / "彼は完全にonestな人です。"

definition_en: To conceive or see something within one's mind. To imagine.
example: The company envisioned a new market by developing innovative products. / 会社は新しい市場を開発するinnovative製品によって、計画している。

definition_en: To fall heavily due to lack of energy.
meanings_ja: 下り坂を走った（競技などでの失敗）
example: The new restaurant really flopped. / 新しいレストランは大損失だった。
The new technology was game-changing for the industry. / その新技術は業界に革命をもたらした。

definition_en: To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio.
meanings_ja: 適器（gear）を組み立てること
example: The company is gearing up for a major expansion / その会社は大きな拡張に備えている

definition_en: To make dizzy or unsteady.
meanings_ja: 感情的にうたれてしまう
example: She felt giddy after eating too much sugar. / she felt clumsy and euphoric after eating too much sugar.

definition_en: A ceremony to mark the beginning of construction.
meanings_ja: 新しい発見のために道を拓く
役立つ新しいアイデアや実践を提案する
example: The new medical treatment was groundbreaking, revolutionizing the way doctors approach patient care. / 新医療法は、患者の看護方法に大きな転換をもたらした。

definition_en: A metallic color.
example: The metallic taste of the iron supplement was unpleasant. / 鉄分เสร薬の金属様の味は不快だった。

definition_en: A greasy secretion with a powerful odour, produced in a glandular sac of the male musk deer and used in the manufacture of perfumes.
example: The musk is a key ingredient in perfume-making. / パフュームづくりのキーイングリデントは、香料です。

definition_en: (of words, equipment, etc.) No longer in use; gone into disuse; disused or neglected (often by preference for something newer, which replaces the subject).
meanings_ja: 古くて使わなくなった
新技術に置き換えられた
example: The old software was considered obsolete and was no longer supported. / 古いソフトウェアは、新しい技術に置き換えられていたため、サポートされなかった。

definition_en: The act of revealing or disclosing.
example: The scientist's latest discovery was a revelation to the medical community. / 医療界に最新の発見が明白の出現した。

definition_en: Something or someone of very large stature, greatness, or godliness.
example: The company was referred to as a titan in its industry. / その業界では巨大な企業と呼ばれました。

definition_en: An unaccented beat at the start of a musical phrase.
example: The upbeat song made me feel happy. / 楽々しい曲が私を幸福にした。

definition_en: To guide people to their seats.
example: The new employee was ushered into the meeting room. / 新しい社員は会議室に導かれました。

definition_en: A whirring or hissing sound (as above).
example: She's a whiz at math. / 彼女は数学のスーパー。
